content.question:
Id hoc facilius eis persuasit, quod undique loci natura Helvetii continentur: una ex

parte flumine Rheno latissimo atque altissimo, qui agrum Helvetium a Germanis

dividit; altera ex parte monte Iura altissimo, qui est inter Sequanos et Helvetios; tertia

lacu Lemanno et flumine Rhodano, qui provinciam nostram ab Helvetiis dividit. His

5rebus fiebat ut et minus late vagarentur et minus facile finitimis bellum inferre

possent: qua ex parte homines bellandi cupidi magno dolore adficiebantur.

Bellum Gallicum 1. 2

Answer the following questions in English unless the question specifically asks you to write out Latin words. Number your answer to each question.

1. What are the case and use of eis (line 1) ?

2. In lines 1-3 (Id . . . dividit), identify one Latin word that can be translated “territory.”

3. (A) What are the case and number of qui (line 3) and (B) to which Latin noun does it refer?

4. In lines 4-6 (His . . . adficiebantur), (A) identify one subjunctive verb and (B) explain why it is in the subjunctive mood.

5. In lines 4-6 (His . . . possent), which four Latin words mean that the Helvetians have the ability to do harm to other tribes?

6. In this passage, (A) identify one gerund and (B) translate it in context.

7. In line 4-6 (His . . . adficiebantur), which two Latin words indicate the emotional effect of their homeland on the Helvetians?

8. In this passage, (A) identify one comparative adverb and (B) translate it in context.

9. Later in Book I, (A) what stops the Helvetians’ attempt to migrate and (B) where do they ultimately have to settle? Answer in 1-2 complete sentences.
